body: @bolkedebruin I'm not focusing on LDAP for now, since @jgao54 is actively moving us off of this on to the FAB framework, which has built-in LDAP integration already.
LGTM
LGTM +1

Can you let your title match what you are doing? 

More importantly, I really don't like this code duplication. If we really do it this way, then it should be included in a separate file and sourced from there.

I think merging authentication/authorization is a better idea or refactoring the views into API calls.
Can you rename the file to mirror the file it is testing?
Tests please and please quash your commits.
@bolkedebruin the latest_runs api method isn't documented, hence you could argue that we could simply remove it from the experiment api. This would resolve the duplicate code issue
cc @saguziel you are the author of "latest_runs" in the API.I would agree with @NielsZeilemaker but maybe you are using it outside the the UI?
Your tests are not running as they are not prepended by "test_". Please verify in the travis that your tests run.
